articles.author: Sandee LaMotte
articles.title: 1 in 10 Americans over 65 have dementia, study finds - CNN
articles.description: Rates of dementia and mild cognitive decline rise every five years after 65, a new study found. African Americans were more likely to have dementia, and Hispanics were more likely to suffer from mild cognitive impairment.
articles.content: One in 10 Americans over 65 had dementia, while 22% experienced mild cognitive impairment, the earliest stage of the slow slide into senility, according to a new study conducted between 2016 and 2017… [+7123 chars]
